intro.description: In this cheatsheet, we will see the basics of how to design a report. In the report creation process there are three main steps: creating a data source or a database connection used to fill the report, designing the report layout and running the report. To keep things simple, this tutorial uses a sample database included in the installation of Jaspersoft Studio. The data to print is retrieved using a SQL query defined during the creation of the datasource.

item.title: Start the Creation
item.description: The first thing to do is start the wizard for the creation of a new report. To do this open the File menu and select the item New and then Jasper Report.

item.title: Select the template
item.description: In the first step of the wizard you can choose a template for the report, select the template Coffee and hit Next.

item.title: Define the report name and location
item.description: You now must choose a location and a name for the report, for this parameters you can choose whatever you want, even the default values are good, then hit Next.

item.title: Creation of the main data adapter
item.description: Now we must define a datasource, and we will use a database provided by default with JasperSoft Studio. For the field Data Adapte select from the drop down list the item Sample DB - Database JDBC Connection. Now you must insert a query to define which data will be extracted from the database, use select * from orders, then hit Next.

item.title: Add the field to the Report
item.description: Using the query provided in the previous step some fields are discovered and you can choose which ones add to the report. Double click on the field ORDERID, SHIPADDRESS and SHIPCITY. Then hit Next.

item.title: Finish the Wizard
item.description: In the next step you can group the data, but we don't need the grouping at this time, so hit Next and then Finish.

item.title: Preview the Report
item.description: Now you have your report with some fields into it. You can check if it is all right by click into the Preview tab. Doing this the report will be compiled and the result is shown.
